-
111.048
727,615
687,390
40,225
823.538
748.976
74,562
921,182
849,827
71,355
The experience of 110 country in telegraphy
is more instructive or encouraging than Swe-
den. It should be borne in mind that it is a
sparsely-settled country; nor is it thickly dotted
with enterprising towns, nor are they lying
within easy distances of each other. In fact
the country possesses only nine cities with a
population exceeding ten thousand, and these
are situated at different corners of the State.
Besides, it is a mountainous country, and a diffi-
cult one in which to construct and maintain
telegraph lines. Yet, with a uniform rate for
all distances of thirty cents for twenty words
and one cent, for each additional word, it
afforded in the years 1866 and 1867 a profit of
81,150 francs and 60,178 francs to the Govern-
ment.
SWEDEN.
Number of stations, lengths of
lines, &c.

Lengths of
! lines.

wires.

tions.
